intro: Eupatorium pseudofastigiatum var. crenato-dentata, commonly known as the roughleaf boneset, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It features tall, erect stems covered in fine hairs, often reaching heights of up to 2 meters. The plant produces small, white to pale purple flowers arranged in dense, cylindrical clusters called heads. Its leaves are broadly ovate with wavy, toothed margins, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands, and is often found in the understory of wooded areas.
